remarks: An element is the generator of a finite group iff the order of the generator equals the order of the group.  (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 21-Apr-2016.)
statement:
iscyg.1 $e |- B = ( Base ` G ) $.
iscyg.2 $e |- .x. = ( .g ` G ) $.
iscyg3.e $e |- E = { x e. B | ran ( n e. ZZ |-> ( n .x. x ) ) = B } $.
cyggenod.o $e |- O = ( od ` G ) $.
cyggenod $p |- ( ( G e. Grp /\ B e. Fin ) -> ( X e. E <-> ( X e. B /\ ( O ` X ) = ( # ` B ) ) ) ) $.
$d .x. n x $.
$d B n x $.
$d G n x $.
$d O n $.
$d X n x $.
